m_descr:
The intent of this Z-Way module is to provide a quick and easy way to create beautiful sensor logging graphs. The data is stored in a database. The HTTP API allows it to be installed locally and on any system on the network.
No Internet service is necessary.

Example Graphs
HowTos

Displaying the Charts
  • via browser command:
    • Chart Index: http;//zway_server:8083/ZAutomation/api/v1/load/modulemedia/MxChartDB/HTML/index.html
    • Chart Administration: http;//zway_server:8083/ZAutomation/api/v1/load/modulemedia/MxChartDB/HTML/admin.html
  • via intchart symbol at sensor widget

Guides (available after download)
How to install and update the database software
Everything you need for installation is included in this package (Linux only).
DBName_label: Name of the database for the chart
DBName_helper: Only letters and numbers allowed, default: MxChartDB for all charts.
IndexDBName_helper: The global chart index is stored in this database.
dataControl: Data control: what to do with already stored data
dc_clear: start a new chart, remove any stored data
dc_normal: continue the chart, add new data
dc_continue: continue, add new data, even if the configuration has changed
interval_helper: When time interval exceeds old entries are removed.
initialInterval: Initially shown time period in chart
startFullTimes: Interval start at exact times (full hour, day, week)
startFullTimes_helper1: Checked: all values are read only at the precisely defined times.
startFullTimes_helper2: Unchecked: values are read at distributed times. Rectangele devices always at change.
startFullTimes_helper3: Only check if really necessary. Instances shouldn't run all at same time.
run_after_start: Store a dataset immediately after start
lowerLimitY1: Suggested lower limit of the main y-axe
upperLimitY1: Suggested upper limit of the main y-axe
lowerLimitY2: Suggested lower limit of the second y-axe
upperLimitY2: Suggested upper limit of the second y-axe
use_nonnumeric: Details to text/icon values on the y-axe
nonnumericLabels_helper1: Up to 2 text labels: a special part is created for this purpose.
nonnumericLabels_helper2: More than 2 text labels: integrated into a possible numeric part.
y3Labeling_helper1: Comma separated list of unique labels, sorted top-down.
y3Labeling_helper2: Empty strings create gaps. Use emojis to beautify.
y3Labeling_helper3: Add spaces or invisible characters \\u200B to make equal strings unique.
y3Icons_helper1: Comma separated list of icons, same order as in text label list.
y3Icons_helper2: Without path and without extension .png: standard zway icon.
y3Icons_helper3: With extension .png and without (complete) path: local icon from htdocs (sub)folder.
y3Icons_helper4: With complete path: icon from any web address.
y3reduceUnusedTicks: Shorten y-axis, if not all text labels are used (top-down)
nightText: The coloring of the nights is done in the browser. It is necessary to add the location coordinates to constants.js.
formula-label: Arithmetic operation (>> help)
formula-helper: Javascript formula (optional). Variables: x=current value, x<no>=sensor value index, x0=time stamp, x[-1]=last x-value, x<no&gt[-1]=last x<no&gt-value.
formula-helper2: All x-values read from the database.
graphType_points: single points on sensor value change
intcharticon_label: Add an icon to device to call the chart
intcharticon_helper: You can only add at most 1 chart icon to every device!
limitYAxis_label: Maximum value of the main y-axis
limitYAxis_helper: Sensor values exceeding this limit use a second y-axis at other side.
opacity_label: Default color opacity of filled space (%)
store_value_set: Poll period: store a complete value set
poll_never: never, only store the chart definition
poll_interval_rectangle: when time expired and any rectangel device value changed
poll_interval_value_change: when time expired and any device value changed
post_calc: Option: In-Display Calculation (>> help)
post_calc_helper1: Define which data to compute in the dialog.
global_js: Option: User defined Javascript code (>> help)
global_js_helper1: For to define globally valid constants, variables and functions.
post_processing: Option: Post processing (>> help)
post_processing_helper1: This code is performed on the visible display right after all data is processed.
